text: Furthermore , we report that <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> has an antiproliferative effect in B cells stimulated with anti-IgM alone or the combined action of anti-IgM and <extra_id_0> CD40L <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
Additionally , <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induces cell death in activated memory B cells and Ramos cells .

Taken together , these results provide a rationale to further examine the role of <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signalling in normal B cell biology as well as in pathologic conditions like B cell malignancies and autoimmune disorders .
